description: Dive into "Nha Trang's Captivating Photo Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Nha Trang's Captivating Photo Escapes

places.generalDescription: Skylight Nha Trang is a luxurious rooftop club located on the 45th floor of the Best Western Premier Havana Nha Trang hotel. It boasts an expansive space featuring 3 bars, 4 event areas, 3 DJ tables, and a stunning swimming pool. The club's glamorous decor exudes sophistication and style. Additionally, Skylight House offers an open-air complex with dining and entertainment spaces designed as a lighthouse on the hotel's 43rd floor.

sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Nha Trang

places.name: Skylight & L√° Kitchen Nha Trang

reviews.text:
Gorgeous views. Only came in for drinks so I didn't try the food. Cocktails were very tasty. Went earlier in the evening before the crowds and it's a nice place to chill and have a drink with a beautiful view. Later in the evening the music and crowds get a little loud but a good place to drink and party if you're looking for that.

Service is great. Staff is so friendly. 200k entrance ticket fee.  Definitely worth checking out while you're in Nha Trang.

The view of the place is amazing. Everything from service to the atmosphere is great. Really recommend this place, must visit when in Nha Trang. Service is amicable, we can birthday celebration and Tram has helped as a lot with preparation celebrations. Thanks a lot, we also won free drinks which were delicious and beautiful.

Arrived at 7PM - Very Quiet! ‚ô°

We paid 200k each to get to the rooftop and a drink was included. (The variety of drinks was really good!) The view is amazing from up there and we enjoyed it a lot. It's not too hot at all, since they have fans everywhere.

We also had dinner there and chose the two people menu with Shrimps, pork ribs, bread, steamed rice, morning glory with garlic and two passionfruit desserts. Everything was great, but the dessert was a bit too sweet for our taste. The service was good, but having a bit more privacy and some distance would have been great.

We really loved the magician there and also we won a vietnamese hat with the logo of Skylight. ü§≠

All in all it was a good evening and everything was well managed. ‚ô°

BUT: They charge extra taxes on the prices and we ended up paying 120k more for our meal. Just to let you know.

places.address: Havana Nha Trang Hotel, 38 Tr·∫ßn Ph√∫, L·ªôc Th·ªç, Nha Trang, Kh√°nh H√≤a 650000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Nestled on a serene hilltop just 3 kilometers north of Nha Trang, the Ponagar Temple complex is a captivating blend of history and spirituality. Constructed between the 7th and 12th centuries, this site features four remaining Cham towers, with the North Tower standing tall at an impressive height of 28 meters. The temple honors the goddess of land and serves as an active worship site for Cham, Chinese, and Vietnamese Buddhists alike.

sources.snippet: Lying on the banks of the Cai River, the well-preserved remains of the Po Nagar Towers certainly make for an impressive sight, and it is not without reason that they are one of the most popular attractions in Nha Trang. With some of them dating all the way back to before 780 AD, the four remaining towers represent some of the finest examples of the incredible architecture that the once-mighty Cham Kingdom left behind. In addition to the fabulous brickwork of the towers, there are some lovely stone statues and altars for you to check out, with lots of intricately carved inscriptions also on show.
sources.shortName: Best Things to do in Nha Trang, Vietnam (+Map)

sources.snippet: The Po Nagar Cham Towers are an ancient Hindu temple complex located on Mount Cu Lau. It is one of the oldest monumental structures in Vietnam built between the 8th and 11th centuries. The primary deity here is Po Nagar, or "The Mother of the Country".
sources.shortName: 41 Things to do in Nha Trang Vietnam 2025

sources.snippet: Ponagar is a Champa tower located on the top of a hill which is about 10m above sea-level at the Cai river‚Äôs gate. This is one of the largest Champa heritages in Vietnam and is one of the best place to visit for those who travel to Nha Trang
sources.shortName: Beautiful photos of Nha Trang viewed from the sky Best places to visit in Nha Trang

places.name: Po Nagar Temple

reviews.text:
Impressive ancient temple complex with great views over the river and city. Entry fee is only 30,000 VND, and you can easily visit everything in 30‚Äì45 minutes.

It gets very hot and crowded, so go early if you can. Dress modestly (no tank tops or short shorts), or you may be asked to cover up.

The towers are well preserved and worth a quick cultural stop if you're in Nha Trang. Not a must-see, but a nice break from the beach.

The entrance area and some part of the museum building is very touristic with stall selling souvenirs and refreshments, needless to say this is overpriced.
The entry ticket is very reasonable and when you have navigated the touristy stuff there is some information about the Ch√†m people and culture before you embark on the stairs up to the towers (you can opt to pay to be driven up by an electric vehicle). The buildings are beautifully situated on the top of a small hill. The architecture and details are impressive, one can only imagine how it must have been when it was still intact. Well worth a visit in my view to appreciate the Cham culture and history.

A truly majestic and spiritual place.
These Cham Towers carry deep historical and cultural meaning - you can feel the soul of the place.
Visitors wearing shorts aren't allowed inside the temple, but free cover-ups are kindly provided.
There are many beautiful spots for photos, both within the complex and overlooking the city.
Definitely worth a visit if you're in Nha Trang.

places.address: 61 Hai Th√°ng T∆∞, Vƒ©nh Ph∆∞·ªõc, Nha Trang, Kh√°nh H√≤a 650000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Long Son Pagoda is a modern Buddhist pagoda situated on a hill, offering stunning views of the city below. It is a symbol of Buddhism in the area and features a large concrete Buddha statue. Nearby attractions include the Po Nagar Cham Towers, Alexandre Yersin Museum, Nui Hon Chong beach, and Lanterns Cooking Class. Visitors can also explore local specialties at Dam Market and enjoy the beautiful scenery of the surrounding mountains and islands.

sources.shortName: Must-Visit Attractions In Nha Trang Vietnam

sources.snippet: Although it was founded long before that, Long Son pagoda was moved to its current location at the foot of Trai Thuy mountain after it was partially destroyed by a cyclone in the year 1900. Today, this is one of the most visited pagodas in town and a beloved stop for both locals and tourists. Beautiful dragon mosaics and intrinsically decorated ceramic tiles cover the temple's entrance and part of the roof and the altar inside.
sources.shortName: 14 Top-Rated Tourist Attractions in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Speaking of temples, no visit to Nha Trang can ever be complete without stopping by the Long Son Pagoda ‚Äì the most famous and impressive Buddhist temple in town. Built in 1886, the pagoda is very striking to gaze upon: majestic dragon mosaics cover the roof and entrance while its interior boasts an impressive ceremonial hall. The main feature, however, is its glistening white Buddha statue that towers to a colossal 24 meters.
sources.shortName: Best Things to do in Nha Trang, Vietnam (+Map)

sources.snippet: Long Son Pagoda, sitting at the foothill of Trai Thuy Mountain, attracts thousands of tourists thanks to its peaceful and calm atmosphere. The large white Buddha statue with a height of 24 meters, known as the largest outdoor Buddha statue in Vietnam, adds a unique feature to this sacred place. Having undergone many restorations, Long Son Pagoda still retains its ancient and dignified features.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Nha Trang: TOP 17 best experiences

sources.snippet: Located at the foot of Mount Trai Thuy, White Buddha Pagoda (or Long Son Pagoda) is a spiritual tourist attraction in Nha Trang that you shouldn‚Äôt miss. This more than 100-year-old temple covers an area of over 3000 square meters and features unique architecture with an Asian touch. Inside the temple, there are ancient towering rows of trees creating a cool and fresh atmosphere.
sources.shortName: Top 23+ Place To Visit in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: The major attraction in this pagoda is exactly a huge white Buddha located on the hillside right behind the major compound. This statue is 24 meters in height and considered as a vital symbol of Nha Trang City. There are portraits of monks, who set fire to themselves in order to protest against the corrupt of Diem regime around the base of this statue.
sources.siteName: Vina.com - Vietnam News, Travel, Food, Photos, Restaurant Guide
sources.shortName: 18 must-see Nha Trang attractions ‚Äì what to see in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Long S∆°n Pagoda is a Buddhist temple that is considered one of the main attractions of Nha Trang, along with the White Buddha. The entrance and roofs of this pagoda are decorated with glass mosaic dragons and ceramic tiles. Behind the pagoda is a huge white Buddha from which you have a beautiful view of the surroundings.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do In Nha Trang

sources.snippet: The guides in Nha Trang usually recommend visiting the White Buddha Temple to start exploring the city. The date of creation (and restoration) of the landmark is the end of the 18th and beginning of the 19th centuries. In front of the pagoda is a square with well-kept flowerbeds and stelae obelisks made of stone.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Nha Trang in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: Long Son Pagoda is a beautiful 19th-century Buddhist temple located on the foothills of Trai Thuy mountain. The temple also functions as a monastery, featuring Taoist architecture and ornate sculptures of mythical animals. The main attraction here is the 24-meter-tall Buddha statue behind the temple.
sources.shortName: 41 Things to do in Nha Trang Vietnam 2025

sources.snippet: is located on 23/10 street, at the foot of the romantic Trai Thuy hill, Long Son Pagoda, also known as the White Buddha or Dang Long Tu pagoda, is the largest and most sacred temple in Nha Trang with an area up to 3,000m2. Ancient temple in the heart of the city. Photo: instargram.com
sources.shortName: Discover top 9 tourist attractions in Nha Trang which can not be missed

sources.snippet: Located at the summit of a hill behind the Long Son Pagoda is large statue of a white Buddha who is sitting on a pretty lotus blossom and measures an impressive 14 meters in height.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Nha Trang (Vietnam)

sources.snippet: Long Son Pagoda is the most famous and impressive Buddhist pagoda in the style of Taoist architecture in Nha Trang.
sources.shortName: Unveiling 10 Best Things to Do in Nha Trang in 2024

places.name: Long Son Pagoda

reviews.text:
A peaceful and impressive spiritual site.
The giant white Buddha gazing over the city is truly awe-inspiring, and the reclining Buddha is enormous - a breathtaking sight to see.
The atmosphere is calm and respectful, perfect for a quiet walk and reflection.
Plenty of photo-worthy moments along the way, with great views of Nha Trang from the top.
A must-visit for those seeking both culture and serenity.

We visited Long Son Pagoda on a weekend and were surprised to find it relatively quiet, which made the experience peaceful and enjoyable. The complex is beautifully maintained, with ornate temple architecture, bonsai-lined walkways, and a welcoming atmosphere.

Be prepared for a bit of a climb - there are quite a few steps to reach the giant seated Buddha statue at the top, but it's well worth the effort. The views over Nha Trang from up there are incredible, offering a panoramic perspective of the city skyline, mountains, and coast.

About halfway up, you'll find a serene reclining Buddha statue, carved into the hillside, surrounded by carved monk figures. It's a calm spot to take a break before continuing making your way down.

There is also a bell tower as well to see.

Very peaceful and beautiful place. The big white Buddha at the top is definitely worth the climb - the view is really impressive! The stairs aren't too difficult, but take it slow if it's hot. On the way up, there's a reclining Buddha and some nice statues to check out. Entrance is free, but you might meet people trying to sell incense or ask for donations - just ignore them if you're not interested, no pressure.

Tip: Dress respectfully (no short shorts or tank tops), and try to visit early in the morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat and crowds. Nice spot for pictures and a little break from the usual touristy stuff.

places.address: 22 ƒê. 23 Th√°ng 10, Ph∆∞∆°ng S√†i, Nha Trang, Kh√°nh H√≤a 650000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Ba Ho Waterfalls, located about 25 kilometers north of Nha Trang, is a hidden gem nestled in lush green wilderness. The journey to the waterfalls takes visitors through picturesque coastal waters and paddy fields. The area offers an exhilarating adventure with cliff-jumping and warm water pools for relaxation. Surrounded by dense jungle, it's a popular destination for hiking and climbing. Visitors can explore three different waterfalls, each offering its own unique experience.

sources.snippet: The Ba Ho Waterfalls are a picturesque 40-minute ride away from the city, reached after driving alongside the turquoise coastal waters and the soft rocking of paddy fields. Of the three waterfalls that make up the group, the bottom one is the most crowded but also the easiest to reach‚Äìbut even it is still a half-hour trek through the bright green jungle to get there and be able to dip your toes in the cool water pool. Waterfalls 2 and 3 require a harder climb using stone steps and large boulders and pushing through thicker forest.
sources.shortName: 14 Top-Rated Tourist Attractions in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Located around an hour‚Äôs drive to the north of Nha Trang, Ba Ho Waterfall actually consists of three separate and equally scenic cascades that lie along a fast-flowing river surrounded by dense jungle. The rugged rocks that line the falls and jut out from the thick forest make for an incredible sight. Some brave visitors even dive off the first waterfall‚Äôs craggy clifftop into the pool below.
sources.shortName: Best Things to do in Nha Trang, Vietnam (+Map)

sources.snippet: Here you can swim in the cool river water and enjoy nature during a walk. The many rocks around the falls and deep natural pools have also made this area popular for those who enjoy cliff jumping. The Ban Ho waterfalls are about 20 kilometers from the city.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do In Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Nha Trang is known for its waterfalls and some of the most famous are Ba Ho and Fairy Spring Waterfalls.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Nha Trang (Vietnam)

places.name: Khu du l·ªãch Ba H·ªì

reviews.text:
Bring swimwear. Would recommend good walking gear.

Park itself is nice for a family or picknick day

To reach waterfall 2 and 3 you have to do a bit of light climbing. I would have left my mom behind. For waterfall 3 prepare to get your feet wet.

Forgot what the price was but I think it was reasonable. Plus they gave a bottle of water with the ticket.

Ba H·ªì is an absolute hidden gem in Nha Trang! The hike through the jungle to reach the three waterfalls was both exciting and refreshing, with breathtaking views at every turn. The water was crystal clear and perfect for swimming, and the natural pools felt like a private paradise. There were also adventurous options like cliff jumping and ziplining for thrill-seekers. The area was well-maintained, with friendly staff and clean facilities. It's a perfect mix of nature, fun, and relaxation. I highly recommend Ba H·ªì for anyone visiting Nha Trang - it's a must-see spot!

It's a good half day visit.

The environment is very well maintained and presented.

It is nice walk to the waterfall and a fun swim.

The food wasn't the best, but ok.

Well worth a visit.

places.address: Th√¥n V·∫°n Thu·∫≠n, Ninh H√≤a, Kh√°nh H√≤a 57000, Vietnam

sources.snippet: Located right on the most expensive coastal street of Tran Phu in the city. Nha Trang, April 2 Square is the place that regularly takes place important promotional events of the city, such as National Tourism Year 2019, Nha Trang Sea Festival ... April 2 Square, home to Tram Huong tower - the symbol of the coastal city.
sources.shortName: Discover top 9 tourist attractions in Nha Trang which can not be missed

sources.snippet: Opposite is a night market, selling many items like clothes, souvenirs and food. The highlight of the square is the three-storey Tram Huong Tower (left).
sources.shortName: The charm of Nha Trang from the air

places.name: April 2nd Square

reviews.text:
April 2nd Square is an ideal spot for a relaxing stroll and to enjoy the vibrant atmosphere of Nha Trang. I've spent countless peaceful moments here, walking along the spacious promenade and soaking in the views of the iconic lotus-shaped structure and the ocean beyond. The square is well-maintained, clean, and always bustling with life-whether it's locals exercising in the early morning or tourists capturing the perfect photo.

The open layout and wide pathways make it perfect for leisurely walks, and the cool breeze from the sea adds to the charm. It's also a great spot to sit and people-watch or just unwind after a busy day. A must-visit place to appreciate the heart of the city, offering a blend of nature, architecture, and cultural vibrancy. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Nha Trang!

To really feel, understand and mingle among the locals. One must visit this exact square preferably during the Tet holiday. Children, families, happiness and warmth resonates throughout. Truly an awesome sensory experience‚Ä¶here of some clips of our Tet 2024 experience.

Managed to visit the food fair on its last day - 1st May. Here is the place where I got to try the cooling Ice Apple drink, nice to try, helps in refreshing as the weather is super duper hot.

A nice place to chill during the night even if there's no food fair or other events.

places.address: 46 Tr·∫ßn Ph√∫, L·ªôc Th·ªç, Nha Trang, Kh√°nh H√≤a 650000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Th√°p Tr·∫ßm H∆∞∆°ng, also known as the Tram Huong Tower, is a striking architectural landmark located in the heart of Nha Trang. Its unique lotus-like shape and vibrant orange color make it an iconic symbol of this coastal city. The tower offers panoramic views of Nha Trang through telescopes installed inside, allowing visitors to enjoy the sea breeze while taking in the cityscape.

sources.snippet: Featuring a color scheme dominated by shades of orange and pink, and architecture modeled after lotus flowers, the Tram Huong Tower has become an iconic landmark in Nha Trang. A system of telescopes installed inside the tower allows visitors to enjoy the refreshing sea breeze while also admiring a panoramic view of the city of Nha Trang. Tram Huong Tower ‚Äì symbol of Nha Trang (Source: Internet)
sources.shortName: Top 23+ Place To Visit in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Square‚Äôs significance is Tram Huong tower with three floors. The first floor is the place for fountain, flower garden, decorative statues. The second floor is sculptured in the sail-shapes and flower-shape.
sources.shortName: Beautiful photos of Nha Trang viewed from the sky Best places to visit in Nha Trang

places.name: Tram Huong Tower

reviews.text: This place is beautiful especially at night. There was a show going on right next to it. I'm not sure what this building is but it was not to far from my hotel and I see it every day. Nice architecture and colors. Highly recommended

This is symbol landmark of Nha Trang.
I went there several times both great time in eary morning üåÑ or night  üåÉ.
Sit and see a peaceful sea.

Nha Trang iconic Agarwood Tower. Centrally located on a 7 kilometer stretch of beachfront promenade filled with hotels, restaurants, clubs and coffee shops. Must visit. Lots of free activities, events and concerts, especially on public holidays. #nhatrang #nhatrangbeach

places.address: Tr·∫ßn Ph√∫ Qu·∫£ng tr∆∞·ªùng, Hai th√°ng T∆∞, L·ªôc Th·ªç, Nha Trang, Kh√°nh H√≤a 650000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Suoi Do Pagoda, a 50-year-old temple dedicated to the Chinese Goddess of Mercy, Quan Am, is located just a 30-minute drive from Nha Trang city center. The pagoda sits atop a mountain and can be reached by climbing around 200 stairs. Once there, visitors are rewarded with panoramic views of paddy fields, banana plantations, and neighboring hills.

sources.snippet: This is a 50-year-old temple which was established in honor of Quan Am, the Goddess of Mercy. Located on top of the mountain, it takes approximately 200 steps from the base of the mountain to reach the pagoda, where tourists could witness panoramic views of banana plantations, paddy fields, and neighboring hills. From Nha Trang city center, it takes 30 minutes of driving to reach this destination.
sources.siteName: Vina.com - Vietnam News, Travel, Food, Photos, Restaurant Guide
sources.shortName: 18 must-see Nha Trang attractions ‚Äì what to see in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Chua Suoi Do, located about 30km from the city center, exudes an ancient, solemn beauty. As you climb up hundreds of steps on Hoang Ng∆∞u mountain, you will see two paths leading to two temples in the Chua Suoi Do complex: Pho Da Son Tu and Quan Am Son Tu. On the pray day(8th, 18th, and 28th of the Lunar New Year), people often come to the temple to offer incense and pray for peace and prosperity.
sources.shortName: Top 23+ Place To Visit in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Prepare for the fact that your trip and the further hike to the pagoda (including the ascent up the hill) will be quite long. But it is necessary to see such sights in Nha Trang. From the top you can look at the verdant area of the city, the slopes and endless rice fields.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Nha Trang in 2024 (Lots of photos)

places.name: Suoi Do Pagoda

reviews.text:
The place is very amazing.
We have a temple in a mountain and the temple is on a sky fall, stream.
We have to climb on staircase- step to go to the temple.
We also have a place at top. We can have a great view at temple, and its more amazing if you going up to the top.
The view is so amazing, you can see countryside at bottom, rice fields, village...
Its wonderful more than my word. Go here and take your peaceful place..

Nice Pagoda located at around 30 min. ride from Nha Trang.
Accessible by scooter and car. I took a Grab Car.
The site is a little high up on the side of a hill. You will have to climb more or less a hundred steps.
It is worth a visit for the view too which will give you a nice glimpse at rice fields.
About the complaints of some visitors about garbage being all over the place. Clearly, environmental issues are far from being a priority in the area. However, the temples are clean and well-conserved.  A paradox, maybe but a reality though.
Buddhism stated that : if the good exists there is also the bad. So true.

We drove about 20 minutes from the city centre to visit the temple. There are a couple of hundred steps to get up to the utmost top. It's optional if you want to go all the way to the top or else there are other exits to see the city skyline.
In my opinion, it was just average. Be aware that there is a parking fee to park your car.

places.address: Su·ªëi Hi·ªáp, Di√™n Kh√°nh, Kh√°nh H√≤a, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Situated in the northern part of Nha Trang on Ben Cho Street, Dam Market is a bustling 3-story building that stands as the city's main market. Its unique round shape and diverse array of stalls make it a must-visit for both locals and tourists. From household goods to handicrafts and souvenirs, this market offers an authentic glimpse into Vietnamese daily life.

sources.snippet: This dawn-to-dusk market is a hubbub of food stalls, street action, rushing vendors and bustling little shops. Surprises are plentiful; mangosteens, star apples, beach wraps, leather belts, dried squid and even pickled snakes can all be found. If you‚Äôre after souvenirs, the best spot is the mezzanine in the centre.
sources.shortName: Must-Visit Attractions In Nha Trang Vietnam

sources.snippet: There are plenty of markets in Nha Trang to fulfill your every need, but none of them are more authentic, busier, or more varied than Dam Market. Housed in a circular two-story building, the market is open from 4am, when it attracts mostly locals who arrive here for their daily shopping. Despite the apparent disarray of the place, there's some logic to how the stalls are set inside the market, so you can walk around to discover areas for food, clothing and handbags, handicrafts and souvenirs, designer knockoffs, and a large section for fresh seafood and produce in the back.
sources.shortName: 14 Top-Rated Tourist Attractions in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Dam Market (Cho Dam) is the largest market in Nha Trang and worth a visit. In the covered market they sell electronic devices, gold jewelry and clothing. Stalls selling vegetables, fruit, meat, fish, live chickens, ducks and piglets are located around the market.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do In Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Dam market is one of the attractive places for visitors to Nha Trang. Built in 1970, there are two floors with the circular architecture and V-shaped roof representing a lotus flower which is considered as a national flower
sources.shortName: Beautiful photos of Nha Trang viewed from the sky Best places to visit in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Dam Market, built in 1970, is two storeys high, featuring a circular design and V-shaped roof symbolizing a lotus. After more than 40 years of operation, a dilapidated Dam Market was closed on March 31.
sources.shortName: The charm of Nha Trang from the air

sources.snippet: If you want to shop like a local, then head for Dam Market where you will find a range of handicrafts as well as specialties like dried seafood and local produce.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Nha Trang (Vietnam)

places.name: Dam Market

reviews.text: Good day market in Nha Trang - plenty of stall holders with a wide selection of products over two floors and more outside.
This is a diverse and authentic market in Nha Trang.  You can find clothes, food, fruits, vegetables, coffee etc.  The market is crowded and very colorful.  It is a pleasant experience.
Crocs are good quality for the price. Nike is similar to the genuine product and the quality is different even with the same design, so compare and buy. The price is more than double. Check and buy.

places.address: ƒê∆∞·ªùng ƒê. Phan B·ªôi Ch√¢u, V·∫°n Th·∫°nh, Nha Trang, Kh√°nh H√≤a 650000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Hon Chong is a must-visit attraction in Nha Trang, offering a scenic cluster of coastal boulders and a tranquil atmosphere, perfect for enjoying the sunset. Located at the foot of La San Hill, this unique rock setting is steeped in local legend and boasts a lovely mountainous coastline. The area attracts numerous visitors each year who come to admire the natural landscape and explore the beach for swimming or climbing on the rocks.

sources.snippet: From the central city driving along Tran Phu toward to the North, visitors will arrive Hon Chong vestige and experience the route through pass of Luong Son which is the best place for sunrise and sunset catching.
sources.shortName: Beautiful photos of Nha Trang viewed from the sky Best places to visit in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: The next site in this series of Nha Trang attractions is Hon Chong Promontory. Hon Chong is situated about 3.5 km north from Nha Trang center. It contains massive rocks which lie on top of one another.
sources.siteName: Vina.com - Vietnam News, Travel, Food, Photos, Restaurant Guide
sources.shortName: 18 must-see Nha Trang attractions ‚Äì what to see in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: Traveling north from the town center along Tran Phu Bridge tourists can visit the Hon Chong relic site, then continue along Luong Son Pass to make the most of either sunrise or sunset.
sources.shortName: The charm of Nha Trang from the air

sources.snippet: Often these stones create original figures against which tourists love to be photographed. Local souvenir shops offer commemorative paintings made of pebbles.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Nha Trang in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: Hon Chong is made up of a granite promontory which looks out over the pretty mountain-lined coastline for which Nha Trang is famous.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Nha Trang (Vietnam)

places.name: Hon Chong

reviews.text: I guess if you're in Nha Trang, this place with its rock formations is a must see and because of its historical significance was granted as a  UNESCO  Heritage site. There is also a cultural show here  that highlights some of the traditional musical instruments. We love how beautiful the music is with these instruments and even a non traditional song sounds beautiful when played with these instruments üòâ

A must-visit place when you come to Nha Trang. This place has mant rocks which naturally stacked on top of each other, running from the shore to the sea, creating an impressive natural layout with beautiful and breezy natural beaches.
This place has ancient houses display picture and especially traditional musical instrument performance.
Ticket: 30k/person

If you are a huge child at heart you will love this spot. So many awesome rocks and crevasses to jump, climb and scale over like you did as a kid. A lot of great photo opportunities even if you are not a wild child, there is an easy walking path out to the main rock we will call it.

places.address: Vƒ©nh Ph∆∞·ªõc, Nha Trang, Kh√°nh H√≤a 650000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Monkey Island tourist resort, also known as Hon Lao, is a popular destination located just below the Ninh Van peninsula in the north of Nha Trang. The island is home to around a thousand mischievous monkeys that are unafraid of humans and will even interact with visitors by asking for food or taking their hands.

sources.snippet: Located a short and scenic ferry ride away from Nha Trang, Monkey Island is so named due to the thousand or so monkeys that inhabit it. Bred for export to the Soviet Union, the program was abandoned during the American War, and now the mischievous primates can be spotted almost everywhere you go. Besides seeing what monkey business they get up to, visitors can lounge on the beach and take in the peaceful ambiance, or go swimming, kayaking, jet-skiing, or scuba diving in the surrounding waters.
sources.shortName: Best Things to do in Nha Trang, Vietnam (+Map)

sources.snippet: Monkey Island Nha Trang (Hon Lao), located 18km north of Nha Trang, Khanh Hoa, Vietnam, is a 25-hectare eco-tourism site housing over 1,200 monkeys. Originally established in 1975 by Soviet scientists for research, the island now features various monkey species living freely in their natural habitat. On Nha Trang day tours to Monkey Island, visitors can enjoy daily monkey circus performances and participate in activities like paintball, ostrich riding, and scuba diving.
sources.shortName: The ultimate travel guide and tips

sources.snippet: This amazing island is on all the ‚Äútop attractions in Vietnam‚Äú lists. It is a couple of dozen kilometers from the center of Nha Trang, and in former years served as the site of a scientific center for the study of monkeys. Due to the fact that the center belonged to the Soviet authorities, it officially ceased to exist after the collapse of the Soviet Union.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Nha Trang in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: As you would expect, the island is so named as it is the home of hundreds of primates and this is the main reason why people come here.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Nha Trang (Vietnam)

places.name: Monkey Island tourist resort

reviews.text:
The time to reach the island is, on average, 12 minutes. You can watch the monkey show at 10 a.m., 2 p.m., and 3:15 p.m. The monkeys are cute, some of them might try to grab your clothes if they see a package with food. Bananas and nuts to feed them cost ‚Ç´35,000.

It's not a big island-perhaps it takes about 40 minutes to walk around. But there are many places to take great pictures. I personally like the colorful houses on one side of the island.

Very touristy, they destroyed the whole island, there is nothing natural left in it, they changed its entire structure and paved everything around with asphalt. There are terrible shows of monkeys riding bicycles and all kinds of other stunts. In retrospect, it was a terrible mistake to come here.

But In any case, for those who do want to arrive, important information:
bananas are bought before boarding the boat at the ticket booth - 20k rather than 35k inside.
Price list attached in the pictures, 180k for ticket.
A return boat leaves approximately every half hour. We were there for half an hour, gave the monkeys some food and left as quickly as possible.
Tha monkeys aggressive between themselves but we didn't experience it on humans. You just need to respect their territory and land, and be assertive if you hold bananas because they will test your fear level.

Two stars, not because it's a bad place or even that it costs too much for what it is. It's simply a place suited for children. There's  not much to captivate an adult's attention for very long. We arrived with 2.5 hours to spare before the show. I would suggest cutting it a lot closer unless, you really want to spend a bunch of time swimming in the ocean or sitting around waiting.....at least there's Bia Saigon

places.generalDescription: B·∫£o T√†ng H·∫£i D∆∞∆°ng H·ªçc, located south of the city and accessible via a scenic coastal highway, is a national oceanographic museum housed in a charming colonial-era building with French architecture. The exhibition features an impressive whale skeleton, aquariums showcasing sharks and tropical marine life, as well as various conservation and research areas to explore. This institute, established in the early 20th century, is one of Vietnam's oldest scientific research institutes focused on marine biodiversity and ecology.

sources.snippet: Nha Trang is a coastline city which is honored in many lists such as top 10 beautiful places for diving in the world 2020, world‚Äôs top 50 most beautiful beaches and one of 29th most beautiful bay in the world.
sources.shortName: Beautiful photos of Nha Trang viewed from the sky Best places to visit in Nha Trang

places.name: Museum of Oceanography

reviews.text: We went here on an afternoon. We bought our ticket here. No lines. No crowd. The area is not too big but you get your money worth. We got to see here different sea creatures. Have laboratory related to sea creatures. You can spend around 2-3hourd to explore. Not airconditioned rooms.

Must visit when in Nha Trang, can go earlier before the cable car operates since this opens at 6am. Features a wide variety of marine creatures, some relatively rare ones too such as sea turtles and sharks.

While I do feel that many of the enclosures are currently very cramped, with many animals squeezed into a small space, I hope they are able to raise sufficient funds to expand their habitat.

Ticket cost 40000 for adults and can be bought on-site. As we went very early, we are unsure if there will be a queue for tickets at later timings,  but we did observe crowds building up at the entrance as tour groups come in.

Was a nice morning out of the sun..
I really enjoyed the time in the museum. To cheap not to go and enjoy.
Will go again.
Looks like in the future they will have more exhibition.
Love see the turtles..
They must have been rescued.

places.generalDescription: Tr·∫ßn Ph√∫ Beach, located in Nha Trang, is a vibrant destination known for its leisure activities, sailing opportunities, bars, hotels, and spas. The area is bustling with attractions such as souvenir shops, museums, resorts, and restaurants along Tran Phu Street. Adventure seekers can indulge in cycling, surfing, and snorkeling at the beach. Accessible from various parts of Nha Trang, it's considered one of the best beaches in the area.

sources.snippet: ‚Äì Tran Phu Beach: It‚Äôs the most popular beach of the city because it can easily be seen and accessed from everywhere in Nha Trang. The beautiful Nha Trang coastal city is partly formed by the boulevard running along Tran Phu Beach with swaying palm trees; wide range of seaside resorts, hostels and restaurants. Nightlife is also active here with most popular bars, such as: The Sailing Club, ZIMA, Skylight Skydeck & Rooftop Beach Club.

So amazing, beautiful ,clean, near beach , food  omggggg cant explain more.
Love Vietnam so much
Very nice Avenue/Boulevard. Very developed.

This is the most beautiful road/ boulevard in Vietnam. You can easy working, enjoy the night, clean beach, as well as the night lifestyle. The most important is that you can do sport in the dedicated small route just near the sea. You can jogging/walking all time here.

places.generalDescription: Discover the wonders of marine life at the Institute of Oceanography in Nha Trang. This research institute, with a history dating back almost a century, is located about 6km from the city center. It boasts an extensive collection of over 20,000 specimens representing more than 4,000 marine creatures and various other living organisms. While some visitors have noted that certain areas may need maintenance, the institute offers intriguing exhibits showcasing vibrant coral reefs and exotic sea creatures.

sources.snippet: On your trip to Nha Trang, do not forget to pay a visit to the Institute of Oceanography on Tran Phu Street. At this place, you can have a chance to admire 20,000 specimens of more than 4,000 types of marine and freshwater organisms. In particular, this is also the only place to have restored the giant whale skeleton which is nearly 18 meters long, 3 meters tall, and weighs up to 10 tons with 48 spines.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Nha Trang: TOP 17 best experiences

sources.snippet: As a research institute with a history of nearly 100 years in a coastal city, Institute of Oceanography is far from the city center of Nha Trang is about 6km. This place is a famous marine research facility, leading the country and the entire Southeast Asia region. Institute of Oceanography - amazing ocean world.
sources.shortName: Discover top 9 tourist attractions in Nha Trang which can not be missed

sources.snippet: The staff of the institute, founded in 1920, is busy studying the sea. The institution is home to an oceanarium with aquariums housing exotic fish, giant turtles, sharks and stingrays. On the second floor of the maritime museum there are rooms with stuffed aquatic animals.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Nha Trang in 2024 (Lots of photos)

places.name: Institute of Oceanography

reviews.text: If you want to visit an aquarium but don't want to spend your money for a combo ticket or waste your precious time for a long queue to go to Vinpearl, this place could be a good choice. Price is reasonable  with discounts for students & senior people.

The Institute of Oceanography in Nha Trang, Vietnam, is a renowned research facility that offers a wealth of experiences related to marine science and oceanography. Visitors can engage with scientists and researchers dedicated to studying the diverse marine ecosystems of Vietnam. The institute often conducts educational programs, workshops, and seminars that cover various topics, including marine biology, fisheries, and environmental conservation.

One of the highlights of a visit is the impressive collection of marine specimens housed at the institute, including fish, corals, and other marine organisms. Exhibits showcase the rich biodiversity of the South China Sea, allowing visitors to learn about the ecological significance of different species and their habitats.

For those interested in hands-on experiences, the institute offers opportunities for field studies. Participants can join researchers on excursions to collect data, conduct surveys, or partake in underwater exploration. These activities provide valuable insights into the practical aspects of marine research.

The institute is also actively involved in conservation projects aimed at protecting marine environments. Visitors can learn about ongoing efforts to restore coral reefs, manage fisheries sustainably, and address the impacts of climate change on marine ecosystems. This engagement highlights the importance of preserving the delicate balance of oceanic life.

Nha Trang itself is a vibrant coastal city, and the institute often serves as a hub for cultural exchange. Collaborations with international researchers and students create a diverse environment that fosters the sharing of knowledge and ideas, enriching the experience for everyone involved.

Located by the beach, the institute offers stunning views of the ocean and nearby islands. The beautiful natural surroundings provide a perfect backdrop for contemplation and inspiration, enhancing the overall experience of learning about the ocean.

A visit to the Institute of Oceanography in Nha Trang is not just an educational journey; it's an opportunity to connect with the wonders of the ocean, understand the crucial role of marine ecosystems, and appreciate the efforts being made to protect them.
The ticket price is so cheap, especially students offer just 20k VND only!! (Remember to bring along student's card). There is species diversity and the experience is totally fine ü§ò

places.generalDescription: Nha Trang Beach is a popular destination in the province, offering a relaxed and laid-back atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy the tranquil surroundings and find shade under the palm trees. It's an ideal spot for families to unwind and take in the natural beauty of the area.

sources.snippet: Owning a serious of wonderful beaches, Nha Trang is a popular destination for those people who want to escape from the hustle and bustle life of the vibrant cities like Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. The beaches here are wonderful with white sand, swaying palms, and blue waters. It does not matter if you are staying in a small hotel or a five-star one right in the tourist center; it always just takes less than 15 minutes on foot to reach the sea and the beaches.

reviews.text:
Nice beach , my son love play sand very much but cannot swimming because red flag signal heavy high wave. And very good for my running , weather so nice.
My wife she so lovely lobster street food.

Nha Trang Beach, a true jewel of Vietnam's central coastline, has long been celebrated as one of the country's most beautiful seaside destinations. Nestled along the shores of Nha Trang Bay ‚Äì ranked among the 29 most stunning bays in the world ‚Äì it boasts an endless stretch of powdery white sand that curves gracefully around crystal-clear turquoise waters. At sunrise, the golden rays gently pour over the sea, casting shimmering reflections that sparkle like countless dancing gems upon the waves. The water here is so clear that one can easily see the soft ripples of sand beneath, and its gentle waves create a soothing rhythm that invites visitors to relax and unwind. The surrounding air is fresh and lightly scented with the ocean breeze, while the horizon blends seamlessly into the deep blue sky, forming a breathtaking panorama. Along the coastline, palm trees sway gracefully in the wind, adding a touch of tropical charm. Whether you are strolling barefoot on the warm sand, taking a refreshing swim, or simply sitting and watching the sunset paint the sky in shades of gold and crimson, Nha Trang Beach offers an experience of pure beauty and serenity ‚Äì a perfect harmony between nature's elegance and peaceful escape.

Nice beach of white sand and clear water. Pretty windy in December January with a choppy sea. Difficult-impossible to swim.
The Bay shows a beautiful scenery.

places.address: 102 Tr·∫ßn Ph√∫, L·ªôc Th·ªç, Nha Trang, Kh√°nh H√≤a 650000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: H√≤n T·∫±m, also known as Tam Island, is a stunning and lush island located about 7km to the east of Nha Trang City in Vietnam. It is considered one of the most beautiful islands in the Nha Trang Bay area. The island offers a variety of beach resorts with picturesque natural landscapes and green trees. Visitors can enjoy water sports such as diving, parasailing, banana boat rides, and motorboating along the well-developed beach area.

sources.snippet: Hon Tam Island, located 7 kilometers southeast of Nha Trang city in Khanh Hoa province, is a picturesque island whose name derives from its silhouette resembling a green silkworm facing east. The island has become a beloved tourist destination, particularly famous for its pristine Vietnam beaches with crystal-clear waters and year-round calm waves, making it ideal for romantic getaways and honeymoons. The island's crown jewel is its terrace-designed mineral mud bath complex ‚Äì the largest of its kind in Vietnam ‚Äì which offers a unique wellness experience against the backdrop of mountains and sea.
sources.shortName: The ultimate travel guide and tips

sources.snippet: Hon Tam Island, with its romantic and dreamy atmosphere, has long been a Nha Trang tourist attraction for capturing beautiful photos and attracting many visitors. You can take pictures in the Hon Tam beach with the legendary pier or participate in exciting activities such as walking under the sea to admire coral reefs, a complex of mineral mud baths,‚Ä¶. Beautiful Hon Tam in Nha Trang (Source: Internet)

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant coastal city of Nha Trang, Rainforest is a delightful caf√© that beautifully merges nature with modern design. This multi-level gem boasts an inviting atmosphere, surrounded by lush greenery and tall trees that create a serene oasis. With its unique architecture reminiscent of a giant tree trunk, Rainforest offers various cozy spots for guests to relax or snap Instagram-worthy photos. The menu features healthy bowls, noodles, and aromatic coffee served from breakfast through dinner.

sources.snippet: If you want to choose a location to enjoy the city view, unique service style, varied menu quality and certainly are indispensable to be beautiful pictures, the Rainforest is the ideal choice for you.

places.name: Rainforest

reviews.text:
Loved the place! The interior looks magical, is so spacious and quiet with relaxing music in the background.
The coconut coffee was great and so was the club sandwich. We also got some free green tea (with top ups). Everything was nicely served and the staff were friendly.
We wanted to go back the day after (Sunday ~2pm) but there was quite a long queue to go in!

Found this neat place near the hotel I was staying.   It has food options of both Vietnamese and western breakfast, lunch and dinner.  I ordered the rain forest breakfast. Decent fast and I was full.   It's a good place to go alone or with friends and family .   Only draw back is there were bunch of aunt in the tray where my ginger tea was.    But in vn you almost expect there anywhere. Would definitely go there again

Rainforest was great! The staff were extremely accommodating to me as a vegan, and spoke sufficient English (I can speak enough Vietnamese to get by but it's nice to speak English sometimes). Everyone was super friendly and the environment at the cafe is great! Can't wait to visit their other locations.

places.generalDescription: The Mountain Church, also known as the Stone Church, is a Neo-Gothic architectural gem located in Nha Trang. Built in 1933 on a 12-meter high mountain, it offers stunning views of the city. The church features an ornate bell tower, vaulted ceilings, and colorful stained-glass windows. Its Gothic style includes tall pillars, arched windows, and saint statues.

sources.snippet: Also called the Mountain Church, the Nha Trang Cathedral is one of the largest churches in Vietnam. It features several stained glass windows and a tall square clock tower. The French Gothic church also has a touch of Vietnamese culture in the pink lighting on the tabernacle.
sources.shortName: 41 Things to do in Nha Trang Vietnam 2025

places.name: Mountain Church

reviews.text: The only downside to his revered and sacred site is the visiting hours, which can put foreign tourists in quite a pinch if they are late by even a trivial margin. Donation is possible via QR code at a fixed price of VND10,000, which is very agreeable. All in all, a very hallowed experience during my pilgrimage.

We visited Mountain Church, also known as the Nha Trang Cathedral, but unfortunately arrived outside of opening hours. The gates were closed, and access to the grounds is limited to certain times - mostly around mass.

From the street, you can still see the beautiful clocktower and some of the fa√ßade, but much of the church is perched up higher on the hill and hidden behind the surrounding wall.

Even so, it's an impressive building with classic Gothic-style stone architecture that stands out from the modern city around it.

If you want to go inside, here are the opening hours and mass times:

Visiting Hours:
‚Ä¢	Morning: 7:00 AM ‚Äì 11:00 AM
‚Ä¢	Afternoon: 2:00 PM ‚Äì 5:00 PM
‚Ä¢	Sunday (special hours): 2:00 PM ‚Äì 7:45 PM

Mass Times:
‚Ä¢	Sunday:
‚Ä¢	5:00 AM
‚Ä¢	7:00 AM
‚Ä¢	9:30 AM
‚Ä¢	4:30 PM
‚Ä¢	6:30 PM

‚Ä¢	Weekdays:
‚Ä¢	4:45 AM
‚Ä¢	5:00 PM

A stunning example of Neo-Gothic architecture in the heart of Nha Trang. The church's ornate bell tower, high vaulted ceilings, and vibrant stained-glass windows create a peaceful and inspiring atmosphere. Built on a small hill, it offers a lovely panoramic view of the city. Whether you come for quiet reflection, photography, or to admire the historic design, Mountain Church is well worth a visit.

places.generalDescription: Tr·∫ßn Ph√∫ Bridge offers stunning views of the city and the sea, making it a must-visit spot in Nha Trang. The wide sidewalk provides a pleasant walking experience, with opportunities to capture great photos of the Muong Thanh hotel and beautifully lit shops and restaurants. Crossing the bridge at night is recommended for fantastic night shots and a cooler atmosphere with a pleasant breeze. Visitors can also descend to the sand and sea level for an enjoyable day by the water.

sources.snippet: Traveling north from the town center along Tran Phu Bridge tourists can visit the Hon Chong relic site, then continue along Luong Son Pass to make the most of either sunrise or sunset.
sources.shortName: The charm of Nha Trang from the air

reviews.text: Don't forget to visit here. To feel the beauty, to see the beauty you should come here at least once. You'll see Po Nagar Hindu Temple so nicely on the left side if you come from the city centre of Nha Trang.

Easy bridge to walk across, paths on both sides, lots of seafood restaurants on the north side of bridge along the water, 25 minute walk from downtown. Views are good as you cross, traffic can be quite busy so choose which side you want to walk on as crossing over can be a little awkward ( there is an elevated median strip in the middle)

Great view here, you can stop and take some pictures. See the ocean view, with this side of Tran Phu bridge you can see anything. The city and sea, buildings and street, trees make you have a good feelings. Come and enjoy. You also can down stair and reach your foot on the sand and sea. There also has craft on the each. You can enjoy a good day with it. So I appreciate this place.

places.address: 756X+QMG, V·∫°n Th·∫°nh, Nha Trang, Kh√°nh H√≤a 650000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: The Vinpearl Cable Car is a popular choice for many tourists visiting the extraordinary Vinpearl Amusement Park. It's one of the longest cross-sea cable cars, spanning 3,320 meters (10,892 feet) from the mainland to Hon Tre island. The 15-minute ride offers breathtaking views of the ocean landscape and is a must-try experience with friends and family. The departure terminal is spacious with beautiful architecture and an uncovered parking lot, making it convenient for visitors.

sources.snippet: Linking Hon Tre Island to Nha Trang, the Vinpearl Cable Car takes you on a 3,320-meter-long ride across Nha Trang Bay until you reach the fun-filled Vinpearl Amusement Park. The journey takes around 15 minutes to complete, and the long cable that keeps you in the air is strung up between seven red and white towers that look like miniature versions of the Eiffel Tower. As the cable cars run around 40 meters above the ground and sea, there are lots of fantastic views for you to drink in, and this unique approach to the amusement park only makes your arrival there even more special.
sources.shortName: Best Things to do in Nha Trang, Vietnam (+Map)

sources.snippet: A ride on the Vinpearl Cable Car is one of the top things to do in Nha Trang. Connecting Nha Trang with Vinpearl Island, this gondola ride is over 3,000 meters long and takes 15 minutes to reach its destination. It took over a year to build the cable car, as it needed to be made not only earthquake resistant but also able to withstand strong winds and monsoon rains.
sources.shortName: 14 Top-Rated Tourist Attractions in Nha Trang

sources.snippet: One of the main attractions in the Nha Trang area is Vinpearl Land theme park, which is on its own island so you‚Äôll have to get a cable car to get there. The ride offers stunning views across the bay and is especially pretty after sunset when it‚Äôs all lit up. You‚Äôll find them here.
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Nha Trang
